wolk package¶

This module provides connection to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

To start publishing data to the platform create an instance of Device class with credentials obtained from the platform and pass it to an instance of WolkConnect class.

For more information about module features visit: https://github.com/Wolkabout/WolkConnect-Python/tree/master/examples/full_feature_set

Connection Management¶

WolkConnect¶

Heart and soul of this library. Wraps in all functionality.

class wolk.wolk_connect.WolkConnect(device: wolk.model.device.Device, actuation_handler: Optional[Callable[[str, Union[bool, int, float, str]], None]] = None, actuator_status_provider: Optional[Callable[[str], Tuple[wolk.model.actuator_state.ActuatorState, Union[bool, int, float, str]]]] = None, configuration_handler: Optional[Callable[[dict], None]] = None, configuration_provider: Optional[Callable[[None], dict]] = None, file_management: Optional[wolk.interface.file_management.FileManagement] = None, firmware_update: Optional[wolk.interface.firmware_update.FirmwareUpdate] = None, host: Optional[str] = None, port: Optional[int] = None, ca_cert: Optional[str] = None, message_queue: Optional[wolk.interface.message_queue.MessageQueue] = None, message_factory: Optional[wolk.interface.message_factory.MessageFactory] = None, message_deserializer: Optional[wolk.interface.message_deserializer.MessageDeserializer] = None, connectivity_service: Optional[wolk.interface.connectivity_service.ConnectivityService] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Exchange data with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Variables

  • actuation_handler (Callable[[str, Union[bool, int, float, str]], None] or None) – Function for handling actuation commands

  • actuator_status_provider (Callable[[str], Tuple[ActuatorState, Union[bool, int, float, str]]] or None) – Function for getting current actuator status

  • configuration_handler (Callable[[dict], None] or None) – Function for handling configuration commands

  • configuration_provider (Callable[[None], dict] or None) – Function for getting current configuration options

  • connectivity_service (ConnectivityService) – Means of sending/receiving data

  • device (Device) – Contains device key and password, and actuator references

  • firmware_update (FirmwareUpdate or None) – Firmware update handler

  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory

  • message_deserializer (MessageDeserializer) – Deserializer of inbound messages

  • message_factory (MessageFactory) – Create messages to send

  • message_queue (MessageQueue) – Store data before sending

add_alarm(reference: str, active: bool, timestamp: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]¶

Publish an alarm to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters

  • reference (str) – Reference of the alarm

  • active (bool) – Current state of the alarm

  • timestamp (Optional[int]) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign

add_sensor_reading(reference: str, value: Union[bool, int, float, str], timestamp: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]¶

Publish a sensor reading to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters

  • reference (str) – The reference of the sensor

  • value (Union[bool, int, float, str]) – The value of the sensor reading

  • timestamp (Optional[int]) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign

connect() → None[source]¶

Connect the device to the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

If the connection is made, then it also sends information regarding current actuator statuses,configuration option values, list of files present on device, current firmware version and the result of the firmware update process.

Raises

e – Exception from MQTT client

disconnect() → None[source]¶

Disconnect the device from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

publish() → None[source]¶

Publish all currently stored messages to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

publish_actuator_status(reference: str) → None[source]¶

Publish the current actuator status to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters

reference (str) – reference of the actuator

publish_configuration() → None[source]¶

Publish current device configuration to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

MQTT connectivity service¶

Connectivity service based on MQTT protocol.

class wolk.mqtt_connectivity_service.MQTTConnectivityService(device: wolk.model.device.Device, topics: List[str], qos: Optional[int] = 0, host: Optional[str] = 'api-demo.wolkabout.com', port: Optional[int] = 8883, ca_cert: Optional[str] = None)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interface.connectivity_service.ConnectivityService

Handle sending and receiving MQTT messages.

connect() → None[source]¶

Establish the connection to the WolkAbout IoT platform.

If there are actuators it will subscribe to topics that will contain actuator commands. Subscribes to firmware update related topics. Starts a loop to handle inbound messages.

Raises

RuntimeError – Reason for connection being refused

disconnect() → None[source]¶

Disconnects the device from the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

is_connected() → bool[source]¶

Return current connection state.

Returns

connected

Return type

bool

on_mqtt_connect(client: paho.mqtt.client.Client, userdata: Any, flags: int, rc: int) → None[source]¶

Handle when the client receives a CONNACK response from the server.

Parameters

  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message

  • userdata (str) – private user data set in Client()

  • flags (int) – Response flags sent by the broker

  • rc (int) – Connection result

on_mqtt_disconnect(client: paho.mqtt.client.Client, userdata: Any, rc: int) → None[source]¶

Handle when the client disconnects from the broker.

Parameters

  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message

  • userdata (str) – private user data set in Client()

  • rc (int) – Disconnection result

Raises

RuntimeError – Unexpected disconnection

on_mqtt_message(client: paho.mqtt.client.Client, userdata: Any, message: paho.mqtt.client.MQTTMessage) → None[source]¶

Serialize inbound messages and pass them to inbound message listener.

Parameters

  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message

  • userdata (str) – Private user data set in Client()

  • message (paho.mqtt.MQTTMessage) – Class with members: topic, payload, qos, retain.

Message deque¶

Message storage implemented via double ended queue.

class wolk.message_deque.MessageDeque[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interface.message_queue.MessageQueue

Store messages before they are sent to the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Variables

  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory

  • queue (collections.deque) – Double ended queue used to store messages

get() → Optional[wolk.model.message.Message][source]¶

Returns

message

Return type

Optional[Message]

peek() → Optional[wolk.model.message.Message][source]¶

Return the first message from the queue without removing it.

Returns

message

Return type

Optional[Message]

put(message: wolk.model.message.Message) → bool[source]¶

Add the message to the queue.

Combines sensor reading messages of the same reference into a single message.

Parameters

message (Message) – Message to place in the queue

Returns

success

Return type

Device Management¶

OS based file management¶

OS File Management module.

class wolk.os_file_management.OSFileManagement(preferred_package_size: int, max_file_size: int, download_location: str)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interface.file_management.FileManagement

File transfer manager.

Enables device to transfer files from WolkAbout IoT Platform package by package or/and URL download as well as report list of files currently on device and delete them on request.

Start making package requests and set status to file transfer.

Parameters

  • file_name (str) – File name

  • file_size (int) – Size in bytes

  • file_hash (str) – base64 encoded sha256 hash of file

LoggerFactory Module.
